data.enText: supply
a supply of goods that is available for sale in a shop/store
We have a fast turnover of stock.
That particular model is not currently in stock .

data.chText: 很遗憾，我们暂时脱销了。
data.enText: I'm afraid we're temporarily out of stock .

data.chText: 松木家具我们备货不多。
data.enText: We don't carry a large stock of pine furniture.
a supply of sth that is available for use

data.chText: 这些年来她积累了大量教学资料。
data.enText: She's built up a good stock of teaching materials over the years.
Food stocks are running low.

data.chText: 一个国家的住房保有量
data.enText: a country's housing stock (= all the houses available for living in)
finance
the value of the shares in a company that have been sold
a share that sb has bought in a company or business
stock prices
stocks and shares
money that is lent to a government at a fixed rate of interest; an official document that gives details of this
government stock
farm animals
farm animals, such as cows and sheep, that are kept for their meat, wool, etc.
breeding stock
family/ancestors
having the type of family or ancestors mentioned
food
a liquid made by cooking bones, meat, etc. in water, used for making soups and sauces
vegetable stock
for punishment
a wooden structure with holes for the feet, used in the past to lock criminals in as a form of punishment, especially in a public place
respect
the degree to which sb is respected or liked by other people
Their stock is high/low .
of gun
the part of a gun that you hold against your shoulder when firing it
plant
a garden plant with brightly coloured flowers with a sweet smell
theatre
on the stocks
in the process of being made, built or prepared

data.chText: 我们已着手生产新的款式，明年春天就可以上市。
data.enText: Our new model is already on the stocks and will be available in the spring.
take stock (of sth)

data.chText: （对某情况）加以总结，作出评估，进行反思
data.enText: to stop and think carefully about the way in which a particular situation is developing in order to decide what to do next
lock, stock and barrel
including everything
He sold the business lock, stock and barrel.
to keep a supply of a particular type of goods to sell
Do you stock green tea?
to fill sth with food, books, etc.
The pond was well stocked with fish.
a well-stocked library
stock sth↔up

data.chText: 在…中备足货品（或食物等）
data.enText: to fill sth with goods, food, etc.

data.chText: 我们需要在冰柜里存满东西。
data.enText: We need to stock up the freezer.
stock up (on/with sth)
to buy a lot of sth so that you can use it later

data.chText: 我们应该在旅行前备足胶卷。
data.enText: We ought to stock up on film before our trip.
a stock excuse, answer, etc. is one that is often used because it is easy and convenient, but that is not very original

data.chText: “无可奉告。”那位演员回答什么问题都是这一句老话。
data.enText: ‘No comment,’ was the actor's stock response.
usually available for sale in a shop/store
stock sizes
on the stocks

data.chText: 我们已着手生产新的款式，明年春天就可以上市。
data.enText: Our new model is already on the stocks and will be available in the spring.

data.chText: （对某情况）加以总结，作出评估，进行反思

lock, stock and barrel
including everything
He sold the business lock, stock and barrel.

data.enText: to fill sth with goods, food, etc.

data.enText: We need to stock up the freezer.

data.chText: 我们应该在旅行前备足胶卷。
data.enText: We ought to stock up on film before our trip.

trans: 在…中储备（或贮存）
贮备；囤积

tr: any animals kept for use or profit
an ornamental white cravat
the merchandise that a shop has on hand
example: they carried a vast inventory of hardware
they stopped selling in exact sizes in order to reduce inventory

tr: the handle end of some implements or tools
example: he grabbed the cue by the stock

tr: the handle of a handgun or the butt end of a rifle or shotgun or part of the support of a machine gun or artillery gun
example: the rifle had been fitted with a special stock

tr: lumber used in the construction of something
example: they will cut round stock to 1-inch diameter

tr: liquid in which meat and vegetables are simmered
used as a basis for e.g. soups or sauces
example: she made gravy with a base of beef stock

tr: a special variety of domesticated animals within a species
example: he experimented on a particular breed of white rats
he created a new strain of sheep

tr: the descendants of one individual
example: his entire lineage has been warriors

tr: any of various ornamental flowering plants of the genus Malcolmia
any of several Old World plants cultivated for their brightly colored flowers
a plant or stem onto which a graft is made
especially a plant grown specifically to provide the root part of grafted plants
persistent thickened stem of a herbaceous perennial plant
the capital raised by a corporation through the issue of shares entitling holders to an ownership interest (equity)
example: he owns a controlling share of the company's stock

tr: a supply of something available for future use
example: he brought back a large store of Cuban cigars

tr: a certificate documenting the shareholder's ownership in the corporation
example: the value of his stocks doubled during the past year

tr: the reputation and popularity a person has
example: his stock was so high he could have been elected mayor

tr: put forth and grow sprouts or shoots
example: the plant sprouted early this year

tr: have on hand
example: Do you carry kerosene heaters?

tr: provide or furnish with a stock of something
example: stock the larder with meat

tr: amass so as to keep for future use or sale or for a particular occasion or use
example: let's stock coffee as long as prices are low

tr: supply with livestock
example: stock a farm

tr: supply with fish
example: stock a lake

tr: equip with a stock
example: stock a rifle

tr: regularly and widely used or sold
example: a standard size
a stock item

tr: routine
example: a stock answer

value.def: Stocks are shares in the ownership of a company, or investments on which a fixed amount of interest will be paid.

example.ex: ...the buying and selling of stocks and shares...
example.tran: 证券和股票买卖

example.ex: As stock prices have dropped, so too has bank capital.
example.tran: 随着股价下跌，银行资本也减少了。

value.def: A company's stock is the amount of money which the company has through selling shares.

example.ex: Two years later, when Compaq went public, their stock was valued at $38 million...
example.tran: 康柏公司两年后上市时，他们的股本为 3,800 万美元。

example.ex: The Fisher family holds 40% of the stock.
example.tran: 费希尔家族持有 40%的股份。

value.def: If a shop stocks particular goods, it keeps a supply of them to sell.

example.ex: The shop stocks everything from cigarettes to recycled loo paper.
example.tran: 商店货品齐全，从香烟到再生厕纸应有尽有。

value.def: A shop's stock is the total amount of goods which it has available to sell.

example.ex: We took the decision to withdraw a quantity of stock from sale.
example.tran: 我们决定将一批存货下架。

value.def: If you stock something such as a cupboard, shelf, or room, you fill it with food or other things.

example.ex: I worked stocking shelves in a grocery store...
example.tran: 我在一家杂货店工作，负责为货架上货。

example.ex: Some families stocked their cellars with food and water...
example.tran: 有些家庭在地窖里储备了食品和水。

example.ex: The kitchen cupboard was stocked with tins of soup.
example.tran: 厨房的橱柜里堆满了罐装汤。

example.ex: I had to stock the boat up with food...
example.tran: 我得在船上备足干粮。

example.ex: Customers travel from hundreds of miles away to stock up their deep freezes...
example.tran: 为了在冷冻箱中储备食品，顾客们从几百英里以外的地方赶来购物。

example.ex: Start planning for Christmas now by stocking up the freezer with some festive dishes.
example.tran: 现在就开始为圣诞节做准备吧，首先在冰箱里备足过节的菜肴。

value.def: If you have a stock of things, you have a supply of them stored in a place ready to be used.

example.ex: I keep a stock of cassette tapes describing various relaxation techniques...
example.tran: 我收集了一些介绍各种放松技巧的卡带。

example.ex: Stocks of ammunition were running low.
example.tran: 弹药的库存正在减少。

value.def: The stock of something is the total amount of it that is available in a particular area.

example.ex: ...the stock of accommodation available to be rented.
example.tran: 可供租赁的住房储备量

value.def: If you are from a particular stock, you are descended from a particular group of people.

example.ex: We are both from working class stock.
example.tran: 我们俩都出身于工人家庭。

example.ex: ...blacks, Asians and people of Mediterranean stock.
example.tran: 黑人、亚洲人和地中海沿岸高加索人的后裔

value.def: Stock are cattle, sheep, pigs, or other animals which are kept by a farmer, usually ones which have been specially bred.

example.ex: I am carefully selecting the breeding stock...
example.tran: 我正在精心挑选种畜。

example.ex: His herd of 170 dairy cattle and 200 young stock are kept on the land.
example.tran: 他那170头奶牛和200头乳牛都在那块地上圈养。

value.tran: (尤指经过特殊饲养的)家畜，牲畜

value.def: A stock answer, expression, or way of doing something is one that is very commonly used, especially because people cannot be bothered to think of something new.

example.ex: My boss had a stock response — 'If it ain't broke, don't fix it!'...
example.tran: 我上司总是这一句——“别没事找事！”

example.ex: National security is the stock excuse for keeping things confidential.
example.tran: 国家安全常被用作对一些事情保密的挡箭牌。

value.tran: (回答、说法或做事方式)老一套的，陈腐的

value.def: Stock is a liquid, usually made by boiling meat, bones, or vegetables in water, that is used to give flavour to soups and sauces.
In former times, the stocks were an instrument of punishment. A criminal's hands and legs were locked into holes in a wooden frame while people threw things at them.
If goods are in stock, a shop has them available to sell. If they are out of stock, it does not.

example.ex: Check that your size is in stock...
example.tran: 查查你的尺码是否有货。

example.ex: Lemon and lime juice were both temporarily out of stock.
example.tran: 柠檬汁和酸橙汁暂时都缺货。

value.def: If you take stock, you pause to think about all the aspects of a situation or event before deciding what to do next.

example.ex: It was time to take stock of the situation...
example.tran: 是时候统观一下形势了。

example.ex: I was forty, the age when people take stock and change their lives.
example.tran: 我已年届不惑，到了该全面审视自己并改变生活的年龄了。

value.tran: 作出整体估量;全面分析

基金，股本，资本总额，股份总额，实际资本，资本货物
普通股
股票投资；股票投資；证券投资学；证券投资
处理库存；库存管理；库存控制；采购管理；储备管理
